gate_name: Correction (Work on What Has Been Spoiled)

18.1.hd_quote: The adherence to traditional patterns despite changing circumstances.
18.1.behavioral_axis: Corrects through gradual modifications of judgments, establishing foundation by respecting traditional authority while slowly bringing about necessary change.
18.1.shadow_axis: Refuses to correct established authority, rigidly adhering to patterns that guarantee deterioration through inflexibility.
18.1.source: Line Companion (Ra Uru Hu) via normalized chunks

18.2.hd_quote: The recognition that what has been spoilt is irreversible.
18.2.behavioral_axis: Naturally recognizes what cannot be corrected, called out by others to project correction needs outward or accept irreversibility.
18.2.shadow_axis: Rages futilely against unchangeable patterns, refusing to accept that correction is impossible and projecting obsessively without letting go.
18.2.source: Line Companion (Ra Uru Hu) via normalized chunks

18.3.hd_quote: The energetic obsession to clean house.
18.3.behavioral_axis: Experiments obsessively with corrections through trial-and-error, dissolving old forms and perfecting patterns through energetic critical engagement.
18.3.shadow_axis: Corrects compulsively without satisfaction, creating as many problems as solved through rigid judgmentation that never achieves completion.
18.3.source: Line Companion (Ra Uru Hu) via normalized chunks

18.4.hd_quote: The inability to correct and its potential for suffering.
18.4.behavioral_axis: Externalizes competence in correcting many patterns while recognizing one thing they cannot fix, seeking networks and relationships to address inadequacy.
18.4.shadow_axis: Generates chronic anxiety and indecision from the one pattern they cannot correct, suffering from demands of correction beyond their capacity.
18.4.source: Line Companion (Ra Uru Hu) via normalized chunks

18.5.hd_quote: The wisdom to both seek and provide guidance.
18.5.behavioral_axis: Holds steady under projection field as both therapist and patient, correcting others through relationships while accepting correction from others in universalized process.
18.5.shadow_axis: Becomes chronically unstable or mentally fragmented when relationships cannot assist in correction, projecting correction outward while unable to self-correct.
18.5.source: Line Companion (Ra Uru Hu) via normalized chunks

18.6.hd_quote: Everything is correct, whether it is or not.
18.6.behavioral_axis: Assumes perfection through completed correction, sharing methodology of why life is perfect while seeking to be spoiled and avoiding corrective engagement.
18.6.shadow_axis: Shares values of correction with others while refusing to participate in corrective process, demanding to be served as consequence of assumed perfection.
18.6.source: Line Companion (Ra Uru Hu) via normalized chunks
